content.description: A sealed container has a rectangular panel that is <math alttext="0.30 meter" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>0.30</mtext><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></mstyle></math> tall and <math alttext="0.20 meter" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>0.20</mtext><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></mstyle></math> wide. The pressure outside the container is <math alttext="35,000 pascals" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mtext>35,000</mtext> <mspace width="0.2em"> </mspace> <mtext>Pa</mtext> </mstyle> </math> and the pressure inside the container is <math alttext="76,000 pascals" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>76,000</mtext><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>Pa</mtext></mstyle></math>.
content.question: What is the approximate magnitude of the force on the panel caused by the difference in pressure between the inside and outside of the container?

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
